sentences.english: We offer justice even to the meanest citizens.
sentences.chinese: 即使是最卑賤的市民我們也讓他們享有正義。

sentences.english: The distinction is no matter its rich and important subject.
sentences.chinese: 尊敬師長就無論他是高貴卑賤還是貧窮富有的。

sentences.english: Too base of thee to be remembered.
sentences.chinese: 太卑賤的穢物，不配被你記憶。

sentences.english: No lowly shameless nauseating and absurd remarks of praise or flattery.
sentences.chinese: 沒有卑賤無恥肉麻的讚美或奉承而荒謬言論。

sentences.english: In the ocean of baseness, the deeper we get, the easier the sinking.
sentences.chinese: 世在卑賤的海洋裏，我們遊得越深，沉沒得越快。

sentences.english: Who is here so base that would be a bondman ?
sentences.chinese: 這兒有誰願意自甘卑賤，做一個奴隸？

sentences.english: Even the humblest have their rights in the world.
sentences.chinese: 即使最卑賤的人在世界上也有自己的權力。

sentences.english: It is humiliating to expire. The supreme floating visions are abject.
sentences.chinese: 這樣斷氣是恥辱的，最後飄浮着的幻影是卑賤的。

sentences.english: She's contemptuous of my humble home and poor surroundings.
sentences.chinese: 她瞧不起我出身卑賤，家境貧困。

sentences.english: And yet boldness is a child of ignorance and baseness , far inferior to other parts.
sentences.chinese: 不過勇氣是無知與卑賤的產兒，遠不如其他條件重要。

sentences.english: A handsome man that he is willing to sign for their handsome and humble living.
sentences.chinese: 一個帥男人的標誌是他願意爲自己的帥而卑賤地活著。

sentences.english: He has brought down rulers from their thrones but has lifted up the humble.
sentences.chinese: 他叫有權柄的失位，叫卑賤的升高。

definition: to curry favor (idiom); playing up to those in power/social climbing
to have talent but no opportunity (idiom)/to be an unrecognized talent
to be content with what one is
to love ease and comfort and hate work (idiom)
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
to think for oneself and act accordingly (idiom); to act on one's own initiative
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
brocade garments, jade meals (idiom); a life of luxury/extravagance
virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
of noble character and unquestionable integrity (idiom)
